tool.name: tool_10

param.name: LINES_OUT
param.dialogReference:
Closed Lines

Shapes, output

The output line shapefile with the extracted lines.

param.name: TOLERANCE
param.dialogReference:
Tolerance

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 0.001000

The maximum distance between the first and last line vertex [map units].

param.name: MAX_LENGTH
param.dialogReference:
Maximum Length

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 10000.000000

The maximum length of extracted lines [map units].

tool.summary: The tool allows one to extract closed lines from the input shapefile. Closed lines are detected by examining the distance between the first and last line vertex. The 'tolerance' parameter describes the maximum distance allowed between the first and last line vertex. The 'maximum length' parameter can be used to exclude long lines.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Conrad, O., Bechtel, B., Bock, M., Dietrich, H., Fischer, E., Gerlitz, L., Wehberg, J., Wichmann, V., and Boehner, J. (2015): System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses (SAGA) v. 2.1.4, Geosci. Model Dev., 8, 1991-2007, doi:10.5194/gmd-8-1991-2015. [SAGA - System for Automated Geoscientific Analyses - saga-gis.org]
